meanings.definition: Having qualities that make a person or thing pleasant or attractive.
meanings.sent1: The puppy was so likable with its wagging tail and playful nature.
meanings.sent2: She was a likable character in the story, always helping others in need.
meanings.sent3: The likable teddy bear made everyone smile with its silly dance moves.
meanings.sent4: Her likable personality was like a warm hug on a cold day, comforting and welcoming.
meanings.sent5: The likable flower garden bloomed with vibrant colors, attracting butterflies and bees.

meanings.definition: Capable of being liked or approved of by others.
meanings.sent1: The new student was very likable, quickly making friends with everyone in the class.
meanings.sent2: His likable jokes always brought laughter to the group, making him a favorite among his peers.
meanings.sent3: The likable ice cream flavor was a hit at the party, disappearing within minutes.
meanings.sent4: Her likable painting captured the essence of joy, spreading happiness to all who saw it.
meanings.sent5: The likable song had a catchy tune that stayed in everyone's minds long after it ended.
